definition: to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain

sentences.english: Now that the exam is near, the students are really going at their studies.
sentences.chinese: 考期临近了，所以学生们确实在刻苦钻研。

sentences.english: She is digging away at her mathematics lessons.
sentences.chinese: 她在不停地刻苦钻研数学。

sentences.english: I just really delved into the comic books.
Being busily engaged in study, Professor Smith sported his door.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯教授忙于钻研学问，他闭门谢客。

sentences.english: Liberation and awakened understanding can’t be found by devoting ourselves to the study of the Buddhist scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 解脱和觉醒无法从钻研佛经中获得。

sentences.english: Secondly, Gray wolf have diligently studying too learning spirit.
sentences.chinese: 其次，灰太狼有勤于钻研的学习精神。

sentences.english: A:Fetch me that diamond necklace,or Heaven have mercy on your lones.
sentences.chinese: 把那条钻研项链拿给我，否则当心你的骨头。

sentences.english: His reward is the pleasure of depth itself.
sentences.chinese: 他的回报是钻研本身带来的乐趣。

sentences.english: He delves into lots of old books and papers for the fact.
sentences.chinese: 他钻研许多古书与文件，以寻找事实。

sentences.english: She said that she would dig at American literature for her exam next year.
sentences.chinese: 她说她一定要刻苦钻研美国文学以应付明年的考试。

sentences.english: read up on a delicious new sexual technique, then practice on your sweetie.
sentences.chinese: 钻研新的新奇的性爱技巧，并与爱人一起实践。

sentences.english: Water creates wood but restricts fire, mirroring the nourishing and flourishing nature.
sentences.chinese: 水生木克火曰则上，具滋润向上，钻研之性。

sentences.english: ZhangChong feel the combat effectiveness of science and technology, secretly hard study.
sentences.chinese: 张冲感受到了科技的战斗力，偷偷用功钻研。

sentences.english: To improve one's professional skill has now become a common practice.
Fetch me that diamond necklace, or Heaven have mercy on your lones.
sentences.chinese: 把那条钻研项链拿给我，否则当心你的骨头。

sentences.english: His erudition comes from his assiduous study.
sentences.chinese: 他的博学来自他的刻苦钻研。

definition: to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to skim (through a book)/to read cursorily/to dip into
diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
level of mastery (of a skill or area of knowledge)/(archaic) to pay a visit to sb
to comprehend (the nature of things etc)/to achieve enlightenment
to forge ahead vigorously/to dedicate oneself to progress
